text: Line 9 (Emerald) (), formerly Line C (Sky Blue), (), is one of the seven lines operated by CPTM and one of the thirteen lines that make up the São Paulo Metro Rail Transport Network, in Brazil.Line 9 (CPTM) Website (Portuguese) ==Characteristics== {| class="wikitable" !align="center"| !align="center"|Osasco ↔ Grajaú |- |- |align="left"|Extension |align="center"|31,8 km |- |align="left"|Average number of passengers carried/day |align="center"|613.000 |- |align="left"|Gap time between trains (rush hour) |align="center"|4 min |- |align="left"|Stations |align="center"|18 |- |align="left"|Trains (rush hour) |align="center"| 20 (24) |- |align="left"|Time of ride |align="center"|53 min (approx.) |- |align="left"|Medium distance between stations |align="center"|1,93 km (1,19 mi) |- |align="left"|Seats offer (rush hour) |align="center"|9345 |- |align="left"|Medium velocity (highest) |align="center"|36 km/h / 22 mph (90 km/h / 56 mph) |- |align="left"|Level crossing |align="center"|0 |} ==Stations== == See also == * Santos-Jundiaí Railroad * Line 10 (CPTM) ==References== ==External links== * Official page of the CPTM * Secretaria dos Transportes Metropolitanos Category:Companhia Paulista de Trens Metropolitanos CPTM 09
title: Line 9 (CPTM)
